item.title: My blog is back
item.description: After a few years of non writing, I'm back. On a blog I own.
item.author: yann.rabiller@gmail.com (Yann Rabiller)

item.title: A free CI (using Docker-Compose) for your Gitlab repositories?
item.description: Gitlab offers good service but their documentation is not so easy to follow and understand. Here is how to use docker-compose on Gitlab, and how to have a free CI
item.author: yann.rabiller@gmail.com (Yann Rabiller)

item.title: Testing your app with docker-compose on CircleCI
item.description: CircleCI allows to use docker, but it's not that simple to use docker-compose with their service. This article shows how.
item.author: yann.rabiller@gmail.com (Yann Rabiller)

item.title: Job offers: Donâ€™t get lost along the way
item.description: Sometimes I wonder what happened between the moment when recruiters started to think about a vacant job position and when they decide to promote a job offer. Small rant.
item.author: yann.rabiller@gmail.com (Yann Rabiller)

item.title: Lessons learned about Bus Factor (Part 5/5): Detect it before it is too late
item.description: In the previous articles we talked about different strategies to keep a balance in your team and avoid giving all the responsibility to one developer. But can we detect when the project starts to take the wrong direction? Can we find a test to prove things are improving?
item.author: yann.rabiller@gmail.com (Yann Rabiller)

item.title: Lessons learned about Bus Factor (Part 4/5): Stay close to the domain
item.description: Writing good code is not only about architectural patterns. It's always linked to your final users and to the domain you are working for.
item.author: yann.rabiller@gmail.com (Yann Rabiller)

item.title: Lessons learned about Bus Factor (Part 3/5): Write explicit code
item.description: This article shows how to refactor code to make it more explicit and help the next developer who will read your work
item.author: yann.rabiller@gmail.com (Yann Rabiller)

item.title: Lessons learned about Bus Factor (2/5): Balancing the level of your team
item.description: What are the non technical measures you can take to improve your Bus Factor?
item.author: yann.rabiller@gmail.com (Yann Rabiller)

item.title: Lessons learned about Bus Factor (1/5): Introduction
item.description: What is Bus Factor? We will here introduce the notion and how it can be useful to your organization.
item.author: yann.rabiller@gmail.com (Yann Rabiller)

item.description: I have been learning German since some time now. Here is what I learned.
